projects.title: LUMINA Project
projects.description: Beyond the common symptoms induced by cancer treatments commonly experienced (e.g., nausea, fatigue…), some symptoms can persist even months after the end of their treatment. Many survivors have reported dizziness, difficulty in attention and concentration, or brief loss of memory. All of these relate to the brain and to what is called 'cognitive functions'. This project aims to explore how brain function is affected after breast cancer and how these changes impact survivors' daily lives compared to people without cancer.
projectDetails: An online study recruiting participants with and without a history of cancer from Finland and France.
An intervention study led Finland, where breast cancer survivors will have the opportunity to try gentle brain stimulation designed to help with thinking difficulties.
projects.about: This project is part of the National Doctoral Education Pilot in Precision Cancer Medicine, funded by the Finnish Ministry of Education and Culture.

studies.title: LUMINA-online
studies.subtitle: Help us understand how going through breast cancer affects brain function, while learning more about your own brain!
studies.description: We're inviting breast cancer survivors* AND women who have not had cancer to participate in a 100% online study that explores brain function, diet, and well-being after cancer.
studies.note: *In this instance, you are considered a 'survivor' if your active treatments (not including hormonal therapy) ended more than 3 months ago.
involved: Engage in brain tests to assess your thinking skills
Track your food intake for a better understanding of your diet
Answer different well-being questionnaires (sleep, mood, physical activity…)
benefits: Get personalized feedback on your brain performance, diet, and well-being
Help advance cancer research and support breast cancer survivors
Convenient & flexible: All tasks are online, available on any device
howItWorks: 3 short sessions (~25 min each) + 1 questionnaire session (~30 min) over 1 week (Monday, Wednesday, Friday, and Sunday)

studies.title: LUMINA-brain
studies.subtitle: Brain intervention study for breast cancer survivors in Finland
studies.description:
Did you notice a change in your thinking after your breast cancer? Try our neural cap, it may help boost your thinking!This study looks at how the brain changes after breast cancer and whether transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) can improve thinking skills. 

 **tDCS is a safe, painless method that gently stimulates the brain using electrodes on the scalp. Know more about the device and how it works** [here](https://soomamedical.com/). The study runs for 11 weeks, including a 6‑week intervention. Breast cancer survivors* are randomly assigned to either real stimulation or placebo (no stimulation), and neither you nor the researchers will know which group you’re in.
studies.note: *In this instance, you are considered a 'survivor' if your active treatments (not including hormonal therapy) ended more than 3 months ago.
involved: Engage in brain tests to assess your thinking skills
Track your food intake for a better understanding of your diet
Answer different well-being questionnaires (sleep, mood, physical activity…)
benefits: Get personalized feedback on your brain performance, diet, and well-being
Help advance cancer research and support breast cancer survivors
Convenient & flexible: All tasks are online, available on any device
howItWorks: 1st tDCS session guided by our team (via video call or held in Helsinki)
23 next tDCS sessions (30 minutes each) at home

projects.title: MARVEL Project
projects.description: Research exploring the value people associate with various common food snacks and how eating behaviors might change under different conditions.

studies.title: MARVEL Study
studies.subtitle: Join Our Study on Food Valuation and Earn €15!
studies.description: We are inviting participants to take part in an exciting online study that explores the value people associate with various common food snacks.
involved: Session 1: Start the task neither hungry nor full (at least 1 hour fasted). You'll rate pictures of food on a computer screen and answer questionnaires for approximately 1.5 hours
Session 2: Begin the task after fasting for at least 4 hours. You'll bid on the same food items for 10 minutes
Final Step (Optional): Visit our facilities for a 10–15 minute body measurement
benefits: Compensation: Earn €15 (taxable income) for your participation
Contribution: Help advance our understanding of food preferences
eligibility: Resident of Finland for at least 5 years
No serious medical conditions (e.g., cancer, chronic back pain), visual impairments, or color blindness
No dietary restrictions, food allergies, or sensitivities
No advanced degrees in nutrition (e.g., Master's or equivalent)
Smoking less than 20 cigarettes a week or using nicotine patches (snus)
